cheatsheet.title: Create a new User Defined Indicator

intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a user defined indicator.

item.title: Create the User Defined Indicator
item.description:
This step opens the "New Indicator" wizard. Right click on the folder "Libraries/Indicators/User Defined Indicators" and select the menu "New Indicator".
At the end of this wizard, a User Defined Indicator is created and opened in the appropriate editor for editing.

item.title: Review the content of the indicator
item.description:
Please select the database specific language (or "All Database Type" if the query is generic enough to work on any database) and review the SQL template in the wizard. The indicator template is a SQL query with some variables represented by the following keywords: <%=__COLUMN_NAMES__%> replaces the column(s), <%=__TABLE_NAME__%> replaces the table name, <%=__WHERE_CLAUSE__%> replaces the where clause provided by the data filter, <%=__GROUP_BY_ALIAS__%> replaces "group by" whole clause.
The default category of the new indicator is "User Defined Count". Choose the category depending on the kind of output the indicator will return.
